paragraph: CHAPTER 26.

The next day, when Mr Seagrave, William, Juno, and Ready were all at work at their allotted tasks, Mrs Seagrave was sitting down at the front of the tent, the little baby, Albert, crawling close to her, Caroline trying to work with her needle, and Tommy was making holes in the ground, and putting a small stone into each hole.
tokens: next day work allot task sit front tent little baby crawl try work needle make hole ground put small stone hole

paragraph: "What are you doing, Tommy?" said Mrs Seagrave.
tokens: do say

paragraph: "I'm making a garden," replied Tommy.
tokens: make garden reply

paragraph: "Making a garden!  Then you ought to plant some trees in it."
tokens: make garden plant tree

paragraph: "No; I'm sowing seeds: look here," replied Tommy, pointing to the stones.
tokens: sow seed look reply point stone

paragraph: "But these are stones, not seeds."
tokens: stone seed

paragraph: "Well, but I pretend, and that's the same thing," replied Tommy.
tokens: pretend same thing reply

paragraph: "Not exactly, Tommy; suppose, instead of eating those beans yesterday, you had only pretended to eat them, wouldn't it have been better?"
tokens: suppose eat bean yesterday pretend eat good

paragraph: "I won't eat any more," replied Tommy.
tokens: eat more reply

paragraph: "No, not of those beans; but if you saw anything else which you thought you would like, I am afraid you would eat it, and be as ill and even worse than you were."
tokens: bean see else think like afraid eat ill bad

paragraph: "I like cocoa-nuts; why don't we have some? there's plenty upon the trees."

paragraph: "But who is to climb up so high, Tommy?  Can you?"
tokens: climb high

paragraph: "No; but why don't Ready climb, or papa, or William?"
tokens: ready climb

paragraph: "I suppose they will get some by and by, when they are not so busy, but they have no time now."
tokens: suppose get busy have time

paragraph: "I like turtle-soup," replied Tommy.
tokens: like turtle soup reply

paragraph: "William and Juno are making a pond to put turtle in, and then we shall have it oftener; but we cannot have everything we like when we wish for it."
tokens: make pond put turtle have have like wish

paragraph: "I like fried fish," said Tommy; "why don't we have fried fish?"
tokens: like fry fish say have fry fish

paragraph: "Because every one is too busy to catch them just now.  Tommy, go and bring your brother Albert back; he has crawled too near to Billy, and he butts sometimes."
tokens: one busy catch go bring brother crawl butt

paragraph: Tommy went after the baby, who was crawling towards the kid, which had now grown pretty large, and as he took up his brother he kicked at the goat's head.
tokens: go baby crawl kid grow large take brother kick goat head

paragraph: "Don't do that, Tommy; he'll butt at you, and hurt you."
tokens: do butt hurt

paragraph: "I don't care," replied Tommy, holding the baby by one hand while he continued to kick at Billy.  Billy, however, would not stand it; he lowered his head, made a butt at Tommy, and he and Albert rolled on the ground one over the other.  The baby roared, and Tommy began to whimper. Mrs Seagrave ran up to them and caught up the baby; and Tommy, alarmed, caught hold of his mother's dress for protection, looking behind him at Billy, who appeared inclined to renew the attack.
tokens: care reply hold baby hand continue kick stand lower head make butt roll ground other baby roar begin whimper run catch baby alarm catch hold mother dress protection look appear inclined renew attack

paragraph: "Why don't you mind what is said to you, Tommy?  I told you that he would butt you," said Mrs Seagrave, pacifying the child.
tokens: mind say tell butt say pacify child

paragraph: "I don't care for him," replied Tommy, who perceived that the goat was walking away.
tokens: care reply perceive goat walk

paragraph: "No, you are very brave now that he has gone; but you're a very naughty boy not to mind what is said to you."
tokens: brave go naughty boy mind say

paragraph: "Billy never butts at me, mamma," said Caroline.
tokens: butt mamma say

paragraph: "No, my dear, because you do not tease him; but your brother is very fond of teasing animals, and so he gets punished and frightened.  It is very wrong of him to do so, especially as he is told by his father and me that he ought not."
tokens: dear tease brother fond tease animal punish frighten wrong do tell father

paragraph: "You said I was a good boy when I learnt my lesson this morning," replied Tommy.

paragraph: "Yes, but you should always be good," replied his mother.
tokens: good reply mother

paragraph: "I can't be always good," said Tommy; "I want my dinner."

paragraph: "It is dinner-time, Tommy, that is certain, but you must wait until they all come home from their work."

paragraph: "There's Ready coming, with a bag on his shoulder," replied Tommy.

paragraph: Ready soon came up to where Mrs Seagrave was sitting, and laid down the bag.  "I've brought you some young cocoa-nuts, and some old ones also, from the trees that I have been cutting down."

paragraph: "Oh! cocoa-nuts--I like cocoa-nuts!" cried Tommy.

paragraph: "I told you, Tommy, that we should have some by and by, and they have come sooner than we thought.  You are very warm, Ready."

paragraph: "Yes, ma'am," replied Ready, wiping his face; "it is rather warm work, for there is no breeze in the grove to cool one.  Is there anything you want from the other side of the island, for I shall go there directly after dinner?"
tokens: reply ready wipe face warm work be breeze grove cool be want other side island go dinner

paragraph: "What for?"
"I must bring the wheels to get the timber out; for I must clear it away as I go, until the path is finished.  I must have William to help me."
tokens: bring wheel get timber clear go path finish have help

paragraph: "William will like the trip, I do not doubt.  I do not recollect anything in particular that we want, Ready," replied Mrs Seagrave. "There he comes with Juno, and I see Mr Seagrave has laid down his spade; so Caroline, dear, take care of Albert, while I get the dinner for them."
tokens: like trip doubt recollect particular want ready reply come see lay spade dear take care get dinner

paragraph: Ready assisted Mrs Seagrave, and the dinner was spread out on the ground, for they had not brought the chairs and tables with them to their new residence, as they thought that they could do without them till the house was built.  William reported that Juno and he would have the turtle-pond complete by the next day.  Mr Seagrave had cleared sufficient ground to plant the half-sack of potatoes that they had saved, so that in a day or two they would be able to put all their strength upon the cutting and drawing of the timber.
tokens: ready assist dinner spread ground bring chair table new residence think do house build report have turtle pond complete next day clear sufficient ground plant half sack potato save day able put strength cutting draw timber

paragraph: After dinner, William and Ready set off in the boat, and, before it was dark, returned with the wheels and axle of the carriage, and several other articles to make up their load.
